synopsis: After a successful debut, STARISH is now on the fast track. Later the President introduces STARISH to Pioneering Princes to teach them what professionals are like.
Haruka meets a prince in her dreams, but was it really just a dream?

Syo’s lands a role in the new Prince of Fighting special with this idol, Ryuya Hyuga. With a successful CD release and job offers, members of ST☆RISH believe they are true idols, but Saotome informs them that they are not yet idols unless they win the ultimate award.
Hijirikawa has been invited to audition for the historical musical, Singing Swordsman of Justice. As people encourage him to try out a love scene in the script has caught him by surprise.

Otoya improvement has impressed the rest of the team, but his random disappearance leads some members to believe he is attending voice training classes. Later, when Cecil is asked to do an impression in a variety show, Otoya is concerned about this pop culture knowledge.

After being invited to be a model for a show sponsored by the Jinguji Group, Ren thinks of the hard times his brother, forced him to become an idol. But an unexpected event at the show may show Ren in a new light.

A woman’s cosmetics gravure advertisement job comes in for Natsuki. However, the client is clearly looking for “Satsuki” and not “Natsuki.” It seems “Satsuki,” who took over HAYATO’s event, would be a perfect poster child for the advertisement.

When he received a song from Haruka his heart’s desire was granted, and his wish to sing Haruka’s songs should have been fulfilled. Though he previously rejected the idea of becoming an idol, having observed the actions and passion of STARISH, he realizes something inside himself has changed.

Cecil disappears from the campsite. However, Haruka, who felt an infinite amount of potential in their seven-person harmony, begins composing a new song for the seven-member STARISH. Believing Cecil will return, the members of STARISH attempt to convince Shining, who tells them to give up on Cecil.

The “Uta Pri Award” has finally been announced. Their joy is short-lived as the other nominated idol group HEAVENS are given Haruka’s songs to sing. When the presidents of both agencies audaciously bet the dissolution of their groups on the award, STARISH is elated.
STARISH is threatening to disband, which prompts Haruka to write a song that will unite them all.
As STARISH prepares for the award show, Cecil has difficulties with the choreography. Syo offers assistance.
